item.title: Leetcode 1332
item.description: 1332. Remove Palindromic Subsequences This problem asks us to find all the subsequences in a string called s. s only contains the letters a and b. When we are doing this problem, the main thing to look at is that it says “subsequences,” not “substrings,” and that there are only two letters a and b. The difference between “substrings” and “subsequences” is substrings are consecutive letters, while subsequences doesn’t have to be consecutive.
